definitions: To make one's way quickly or awkwardly up a steep gradient or over rough ground by using one's hands as well as one's feet.
To mix (ingredients) together in a confused or untidy way.
To cook (eggs) by mixing the whites and yolks together and heating them, typically with milk and seasoning.
To make (a broadcast or telephone conversation) unintelligible by altering the sound or transmitting it in a distorted form.
To compete or struggle with others for something in an eager or uncontrolled way.
examples: He scrambled the papers on his desk.
I'll scramble some eggs for breakfast.
The signal was scrambled to prevent eavesdropping.
People scrambled for the best seats.
